Input to test: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types cannot be repeated and must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types cannot be repeated and must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'
Output: Compliant if each key in metadata is present only once and is a value between 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer', not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the metadata parameter contain only allowed types and only once for each
Description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types cannot be repeated and must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'
Requirement: Allowed metadata types are: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'

Input to test: Trust Mark status endpoint response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger In order to check if the trust mark status endpoint of the AA correctly verifies valid trust marks, a valid trust mark can be sent to the endpoint and the response analyzed
Output: HTTP 200 OK response containing the claim 'active' set to true
Test Name: Does the Entity expose the trust mark status endpoint
Description: In order to check if the trust mark status endpoint of the AA correctly verifies valid trust marks, a valid trust mark can be sent to the endpoint and the response analyzed
Requirement: In addition to the Federation endpoints reported before, the Entities of type TA or SA MUST provide the trust mark status endpoint. It allows an Entity to test if a TM is still active or not.
Note: Chiamata assente in implementazione di Giuseppe De Marco

Input to test: Authentication response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request
Output: Compliant if the OP shows the consent page, not compiant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP show the consent view
Description: In this test an authentication request is accomplished and, when the correct login credentials are inserted, the presence of the consent view shown to the user is checked. If it is not the case, the OP is not compliant
Requirement: If the prompt parameter is set to consent login, the OP forces an authentication request to the user. Then it asks permission to transfer the claims. If the prompt parameter is set to consent, if a Single Sign On session is not yet active, the OP makes an Authentication Request to the user. Then it asks permission to transfer the claims.

Input to test: The Authentication error response is analyzed and the presence of the error parameter is checked
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The Authentication error response is analyzed and the presence of the error parameter is checked
Output: Compliant if the Authentication Response contains the error parameter, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the Authentication error response contain the error parameter
Description: The Authentication error response is analyzed and the presence of the error parameter is checked
Requirement: In case of errors, the response must contain the error and error_description parameters

Input to test: The Authentication error response is analyzed and the presence of the error_description is checked
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The Authentication error response is analyzed and the presence of the error_description is checked
Output: Compliant if the Authentication Response has the error_description parameter, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the Authentication error response contain the error_description parameter
Description: The Authentication error response is analyzed and the presence of the error_description is checked
Requirement: In case of errors, the response must contain the error and error_description parameters

Input to test: Authentication Response to a Request done with the HTTP GET method and the Query String serialization method
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request done with the HTTP GET method and the Query String serialization method
Output: Client redirect to the redirect uri with correct query parameters (scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request) insterted in the URL
Test Name: Does the OP accept GET requests and the Query String serialization method
Description: An authentication request is sent with the GET method and the parameters (scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request) are set as query components of the request, using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format
Requirement: For conveying the request, the RP MAY use the methods POST and GET. With the method POST the parameters MUST be sent using the Form Serialization. With the method GET the parameters MUST be sent using the Query String Serialization. For more details see

Input to test: Authentication Response to a Request done with the HTTP GET method and a wrong serialization method
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request done with the HTTP GET method and scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request parameters inserted in the body of the request using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP accept GET requests with a wrong serialization method
Description: An authentication request is sent with the GET method and the parameters (scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request) are inserted in the body of the request, using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format
Requirement: For conveying the request, the RP MAY use the methods POST and GET. With the method GET the parameters MUST be sent using the Query String Serialization

Input to test: Authentication Response to a Request done with the HTTP POST method and the Form serialization method
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request done with the HTTP POST method and the Form serialization method
Output: Client redirect to the redirect uri with correct query parameters (scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request) insterted in the URL
Test Name: Does the OP accept POST requests and the Form serialization method
Description: An authentication request is sent with the POST method and the parameters (scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request) are inserted in the body of the request, using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format
Requirement: For conveying the request, the RP MAY use the methods POST and GET. With the method POST the parameters MUST be sent using the Form Serialization. With the method GET the parameters MUST be sent using the Query String Serialization. For more details see

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request with a request parameter being a JWT without signature
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request with the request parameter in the url being a JWT without signature
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests without the signature of the JWT
Description: This test aims to verify if the OP checks the presence of the signature in an authentication request's JWT. In particular, since the JWT is composed by three parts (header, payload and signature), an Authentication Request is sent with a JWT without the last part of it, the signature.
Requirement: The Authorization request is initiated by the user that selects the OP for the authentication. The RP redirects the user to the Authorization Endpoint of the selected OP, including in the request the parameter request that is a signed JWT containing the Authorization Request.
Reference OpenID Connect Conformance Pro: Support request request parameter iwht unsecured request

Input to test: Authentication Response to a Request done with the HTTP POST method and a wrong serialization method
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request done with the HTTP POST method and scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request parameters set as query components of the request, using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP accept POST requests with a wrong serialization method
Description: An authentication request is sent with the POST method and the parameters (scope, code_challenge, code_challenge_method and request) are set as query components of the request, using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format
Requirement: For conveying the request, the RP MAY use the methods POST and GET. With the method POST the parameters MUST be sent using the Form Serialization

Input to test: Authentication response to a request with prompt parameter set to consent login
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request with prompt parameter set to consent login
Output: Compliant if the OP shows a login page to the client, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP correctly handle the prompt parameter set to 'consent login' in the case of a new request
Description: In the case of the prompt parameter set to 'consent login' in an authentication request, the OP should send an authentication request to the user in any case. In order to verify this behavior, a fresh authentication request is accomplished and the action of the OP verified.
Requirement: In case of a prompt parameter set to consent login in an authentication request: The OP forces an authentication request to the user. Then it asks permission to transfer the claims.
Note: JWT Response (correct check-yes) but must build custom control of output (login page)

Input to test: The Access Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the value of the 'client_id' parameter in the Payload must identify the client issuing the request
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The Access Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the value of the 'client_id' parameter in the Payload must identify the client issuing the request
Output: Compliant if the JWT Access Token Payload contains the client_id parameter and its value identifies the RP, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT Access Token contain the 'client_id' parameter in the Payload and identify the client
Description: The Access Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the value of the 'client_id' parameter in the Payload must identify the client issuing the request
Requirement: The JWT Access Token Payload requires the client_id parameter. It MUST contain an HTTPS URL that uniquely identifies the RP.

Input to test: Authentication response to a request with prompt parameter set to consent login and SSO session active
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request with prompt parameter set to consent login and SSO session active
Output: Compliant if the OP shows a login page to the client, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP correctly handles the prompt parameter set to 'consent login' in the case of SSO
Description: In the case of the prompt parameter set to 'consent login' in an authentication request, the OP should send an authentication request to the user in any case. In order to verify this behavior, an authentication request while a SSO session is active is accomplished and the action of the OP verified. It should show a login page and ask for the credentials.
Requirement: In case of a prompt parameter set to consent login in an authentication request: The OP forces an authentication request to the user. Then it asks permission to transfer the claims.

Input to test: Authentication response to a request with prompt parameter set to consent
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request with prompt parameter set to consent
Output: Compliant if the OP shows a login page to the client, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP correctly handle the prompt parameter set to 'consent' in the case of a new request
Description: In the case of the prompt parameter set to 'consent login' in an authentication request, the OP should send an authentication request to the user in any case. In order to verify this behavior, an authentication request while a SSO session is active is accomplished and the action of the OP verified. It should show a login page and ask for the credentials.
Requirement: In case of a prompt parameter set to consent in an authentication request, if a Single Sign On session is not yet active, the OP makes an Authentication Request to the user. Then it asks permission to transfer the claims.
Note: JWT Response (correct check-yes) but must build custom control of output (login page)

Input to test: Authentication response to a request with prompt parameter set to consent and SSO session active
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request with prompt parameter set to consent and SSO session active
Output: Compliant if the OP directly allows the authentication request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP correctly handles the prompt parameter set to 'consent' in the case of SSO
Description: In the case of the prompt parameter set to consent in an authentication request, the OP has to verify if a SSO session is active and, in this case, it should consent the request. In order to verify this behavior, an authentication request with the prompt parameter set to consent while such a session is active is accomplished and the action of the OP verified. It should not show a login page, automatically authenticating the user.
Requirement: In case of a prompt parameter set to consent in an authentication request, if a Single Sign On session is not yet active, the OP makes an Authentication Request to the user. Then it asks permission to transfer the claims.

Input to test: In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri and the redirect must have 'iss' as query parameter set to the OP's identifier
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri and the redirect must have 'iss' as query parameter set to the OP's identifier
Output: Compliant if the OP redirects the client to the redirect_uri with the iss parameter set to the correct OP's identifier, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP contain iss set to the its identifier on redirect in a successful authentication
Description: In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri and the redirect must have 'iss' as query parameter set to the OP's identifier
Requirement: If the authentication is successful the OpenID Provider (OP) redirects the user by adding iss parameter required as query parameters to the redirect_uri

Input to test: In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri and the redirect must have 'state' as query parameter. This parameter must have the same value of the 'state' parameter sent in the payload of the request parameter in the Authentication request
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri and the redirect must have 'state' as query parameter. This parameter must have the same value of the 'state' parameter sent in the payload of the request parameter in the Authentication request
Output: Compliant if the OP redirects the client to the redirect_uri and the value of the state parameter in the query parameters corresponds to the state parameter sent in the request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP contain correct state parameter on redirect in a successful authentication
Description: In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri and the redirect must have 'state' as query parameter. This parameter must have the same value of the 'state' parameter sent in the payload of the request parameter in the Authentication request
Requirement: If the authentication is successful the OpenID Provider (OP) redirects the user by adding state parameter required as query parameters to the redirect_uri
Reference OAuch: Is the state parameter present in the authorization response (StatePresent)
Reference OpenID Connect Conformance Pro: OAuth state request value returned in response

Input to test: In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri.
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri.
Output: Compliant if the OP redirects the client to the redirect_uri, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP correctly redirects the client
Description: In order to check if the OP correctly handles a successful authentication request, a correct request is sent by a client and the behavior of the OP is analyzed. In particular, the client must be redirected to its redirect_uri.
Requirement: If the authentication is successful the OpenID Provider (OP) redirects the user to the redirect_uri
Reference OAuch: Is at least one grant type supported (HasSupportedFlows)
Reference OpenID Connect Conformance Pro: Can make request with code response_type

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request without the scope parameter in the URL
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request with the scope parameter in the URL that differs from the one in the JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests with the scope parameter different in the URL and in the JWT
Description: The Authentication Request is intercepted and the iss parameter in the URL of the request (scope in the HTTP request) is modified to a valid value but different from the JWT's one. The same parameter in the JWT's payload is left unchanged
Requirement: The parameter scope MUST be sent both as a parameter in the HTTP request, and inside the request object. The two values MUST be the same.

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request without the code_challenge parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request without the code_challenge parameter in the URL
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests without the code_challenge parameter
Description: The 'code_challenge' parameter in an authentication request is part of the PKCE protocol and is useful against various attacks. In order to test if the OP checks this parameter, an authorization request is sent without the client_id in the JWT and the answer is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the code_challenge parameter

Input to test: Authentication Response to a Request without the code_challenge and code_challenge_method parameter in the HTTP request
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request without the code_challenge and code_challenge_method parameter in the URL
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP require PKCE
Description: An authentication request with empty code_challenge and code_challenge_method parameter is sent and the response analyzed. If the OP accepts the request, than plain PKCE is accepted and a protection against attacks like CSRF and authorization code injection attacks is missing
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the code_challenge parameter. The JWT payload must contain the code_challenge_method parameter and its value must be in the code_challenge_methods_supported parameter of the OP's metadata
Reference OAuch: Does the server require PKCE (IsPkceRequired), Does the server support plain PKCE (PlainPkce)

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request without the code_challenge_method parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request without the code_challenge_method parameter in the URL
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests without the code_challenge_method parameter
Description: The 'code_challenge_method' parameter in an authentication request says to the OP how to verify the code_challenge when receiving the token request. If one request has a wrong code_challenge_method, than the OP will not be able to verify this parameter. In order to test the OP's behavior, an Authenticaton request is sent without code_challenge_method and the answer is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the code_challenge_method parameter and its value must be in the code_challenge_methods_supported parameter of the OP's metadata

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request without the request parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request without the request parameter in the URL
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests without the request parameter
Description: The 'request' parameter in an authentication request is crucial to authenticate and answer correctly. If a request is missing the request parameter, than the OP should refuse it. In order to test the OP's behavior, an Authenticaton request is sent without request parameter in the URL and the answer is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the request parameter and its value must a JWT

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request with the request parameter that is not a JWT
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request with a request parameter in the URL that is not a JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests with the request parameter that is not a JWT
Description: The 'request' parameter in an authentication request is crucial to authenticate and answer correctly. If a request has a request parameter, that is not a JWT, it means that the OP should refuse it. In order to test the OP's behavior, an Authenticaton request is sent with a random value in the request parameter in the URL and the answer is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the request parameter and its value must a JWT

Input to test: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types cannot be repeated and must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types cannot be repeated and must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'
Output: Compliant if each key in metadata is present only once and is a value between 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer', not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the metadata parameter contain only allowed types and only once for each
Description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types cannot be repeated and must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'
Requirement: Allowed metadata types are: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource', 'trust_mark_issuer'

Input to test: In order to verify if the OP validates the trust chain, the signature of the trust marks in the RP's Entity Configuration must be wrong. If the OP validates the request anyway, than it is not checking the Trust Mark signature and it is not compliant with the specifications
Input to Entity Uder Test: Entity Configuration response containing a trust mark with wrong signature
Output: Compliant if the OP responds with an HTTP 302 error and because of unauthorized_client, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP validate the signature of the RP Trust Marks
Description: In order to verify if the OP validates the trust chain, the signature of the trust marks in the RP's Entity Configuration must be wrong. If the OP validates the request anyway, than it is not checking the Trust Mark signature and it is not compliant with the specifications
Requirement: The OP obtains the Entity Configuration of the RP and validates the signatures of Trust Mark that are recognized inside the Federation
Note: Signature JWT Response (correct check-no) but the JWT is nested

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request with a request parameter signed with a symmetric algorithm
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request with a request parameter signed with a symmetric algorithm
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of unauthorized_client, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests signed with a non-asymmetric method
Description: This test aims to check if the OP correctly handles the signature of the Authentication request: If the OP is not able to decrypt the signature, than the public key of the RP is wrong or, otherwise, the algorithm used is not known. If, instead, the OP is able to decrypt the signature, it can mean that the public key is correct and the algorithm known, or that the RP used a symmetric algorithm and the RP's key is the same key used to sign the JWT. In the latter case the confidentiality and integrity of the message cannot be trusted. In this case, the OP must check the 'alg' parameter in the JWT Header and, if it corresponds to a symmetric algorithm or to 'none', it must refuse the authentication request. In order to accomplish this test, a crafted RP could set in its metadata a symmetric key, use it to sign the JWT and send an Authentication Request. Another way to accomplish the test is by intercepting the request, changing the parameter and the signature.
Requirement: The JWT Header of the request parameter in the Authentication Request must contain the 'alg' parameter, it must be set to one of the supported values for the OP metadata and must not be 'none' or a symmetric algorithm (MAC).
Note: Check the error response code in MIG

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request without the acr_values parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request without the acr_values parameter in the JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests without the acr_values parameter
Description: An Authentication Request is sent without the acr_values parameter in JWT and the response analyzed.
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the acr_values parameter and its value must be contained in the acr_values_supported parameter of the OP's metadata

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request with wrong acr_values parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request with wrong acr_values parameter in the JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests with a value of the acr_values parameter wrong or not present in its metadata
Description: In this test an authorization request is sent with a acr_values parameter wrongly set in the JWT and the response is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the acr_values parameter and its value must be contained in the acr_values_supported parameter of the OP's metadata

Input to test: Introspection Request with an expired token
Input to Entity Uder Test: Introspection Request with an expired token
Output: Compliant if the Introspection Response's body is a JSON Object with only an 'active' parameter set to false, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the Introspection Endpoint returns false on expired tokens
Description: To test that the Introspection response of the OP's correctly identifies expired tokens, an expired one is sent and the response is analyzed
Requirement: If the token is expired, it has been revoked or it has never been issued for the calling client_id, the Introspection Endpoint must return false. Otherwise it returns true

Input to test: Introspection response to a request with a token issued for another client
Input to Entity Uder Test: Introspection Request with a token that does not belong to the RP making the request
Output: Compliant if the Introspection Response is a JSON Object with only an 'active' parameter set to false, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the Introspection Endpoint returns false on tokens that do not belong to the RP
Description: To test that the Introspection response of the OP's correctly identifies tokens that do not belong to the RP making the request, a token issued for another RP is sent by a different RP and the response is analyzed
Requirement: If the token is expired, it has been revoked or it has never been issued for the calling client_id, the Introspection Endpoint must return false. Otherwise it returns true

Input to test: The revocation request must be sent via HTTP POST
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger Revocation Request
Output: Compliant if the Revocation request is in HTTP POST, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP verify the HTTP method of the Revocation request
Description: The revocation request must be sent via HTTP POST
Requirement: The OP must test the HTTP method in the revocation request

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The Access Token present in the Token response is analyzed and the presence of the 'typ' parameter in the header is checked. Moreover, its value must be set to 'at+jwt', if it is not, than the Access Token is not compliant
Output: Compliant if the Access Token Header has the typ parameter and it is set to 'at+jwt', not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT Access Token contain the 'typ' parameter valid in the Header
Description: The Access Token present in the Token response is analyzed and the presence of the 'typ' parameter in the header is checked. Moreover, its value must be set to 'at+jwt', if it is not, than the Access Token is not compliant
Requirement: The JWT Access Token Header requires the typ parameter and it must be set to 'at+jwt'
Note: Not present in the description but present in the example

Input to test: The Access Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the presence of the 'iss' parameter equals to the URL of the OP in the Payload is checked
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The Access Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the presence of the 'iss' parameter equals to the URL of the OP in the Payload is checked
Output: Compliant if the JWT Access Token Payload has the iss parameter equals to the URL of the OP, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT Access Token contain the 'iss' parameter in the Payload equals to the URL of the OP
Description: The Access Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the presence of the 'iss' parameter equals to the URL of the OP in the Payload is checked
Requirement: The JWT Access Token Payload requires the iss parameter equals to the URL of the OP

Input to test: Token response to a request with grant_type set to refresh_token and a valid refresh_token
Input to Entity Uder Test: Token request with grant_type set to refresh_token and a valid refresh_token
Output: Compliant if the Token Response contains the Access Token, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP release Access Tokens with the use of refresh tokens
Description: In this test the offline access flow is accomplished and a refresh token is obtained. After this, a new token request is done with 'grant_type=refresh_token' and the refresh token inserted in the 'refresh_token' parameter. The response must include the Access Token
Requirement: The Refresh Token MUST NOT allow the requesting RP to obtain an ID Token, neither the one previously issued during authentication nor a new ID Token

Input to test: This test verifies the presence of Cache-Control set to 'no-store' in the token response.
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger This test verifies the presence of Cache-Control set to 'no-store' in the token response.
Output: Compliant if the token response has Cache-Control set to 'no-store', not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the token response have Cache-Control set to 'no-store'
Description: This test verifies the presence of Cache-Control set to 'no-store' in the token response.
Requirement: The error Token response must have Cache-Control set to 'no-store'

Input to test: This test verifies the head Content-Type set to application/json in the error token response.
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger error This test verifies the head Content-Type set to application/json in the error token response.
Output: Compliant if the error token response has application/json set in Content-Type, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the Content-Type in a error token response set correctly?
Description: This test verifies the head Content-Type set to application/json in the error token response.
Requirement: The error Token response must have the Content-Type head set to application/json.

Input to test: This test verifies the presence of error_description parameter in the error token response.
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger error This test verifies the presence of error_description parameter in the error token response.
Output: Compliant if the error token response has error_description parameter, not Compliant otherwise

Input to test: This test verifies the presence of error parameter in the error token response.

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger To test this OP functionality, a flow is started using an RP that exposes the 'id_token_encrypted_response_alg' parameter. Once received the ID Token, it has to be not only signed but also encrypted
Output: Compliant if the ID Token obtained in the Token Response is a nested signed and encrypted JWT, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP encrypt the ID Token when the 'id_token_encrypted_response_alg' parameter is exposed in the RP's metadata
Description: To test this OP functionality, a flow is started using an RP that exposes the 'id_token_encrypted_response_alg' parameter. Once received the ID Token, it has to be not only signed but also encrypted
Requirement: If the RP exposes in its metadata the parameter id_token_encrypted_response_alg the OP MUST encrypt the ID Token. In this case the ID Token MUST be a nested signed and encrypted JWT

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger In this test, the ID Token is taken from the Token Response, the header is base64url decoded and the presence of the 'alg' parameter in the Header is checked. The value must be an asymmetric algorithm between those defined in the 'id_token_signing_alg_values_supported' parameter of the OP's metadata
Output: Compliant if the ID Token Header has the alg parameter and contains one of the values in the OP's metadata, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT ID Token contain a correct 'alg' parameter in the Header
Description: In this test, the ID Token is taken from the Token Response, the header is base64url decoded and the presence of the 'alg' parameter in the Header is checked. The value must be an asymmetric algorithm between those defined in the 'id_token_signing_alg_values_supported' parameter of the OP's metadata
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Header requires the alg parameter
Reference OpenID Connect Conformance Pro: Asymmetric ID Token signature with RS256
Note: Not present in the description of the ID Token but present in the example. I assumed the signature values

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'acr' parameter in the Payload is checked. It must be equal or superior to the acr send from the RP in the Authentication Request.
Output: Compliant if the ID Token contains the acr claim equal or higher than acr_values requested within the authorization request, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT ID Token contain the 'acr' parameter valid in the Payload
Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'acr' parameter in the Payload is checked. It must be equal or superior to the acr send from the RP in the Authentication Request.
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the acr parameter and must be set to the 'acr_value' that is satisfied by the OP in the Authentication Request

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'acr' parameter in the Payload is checked. Its value is one of ['https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL1', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL2', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL3']. It must be equal or superior to the acr send from the RP in the Authentication Request.
Output: Compliant if the ID Token contains the acr claim and its value is one of ['https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL1', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL2', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL3'], not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT ID Token contain correct value of 'acr' parameter valid in the Payload
Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'acr' parameter in the Payload is checked. Its value is one of ['https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL1', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL2', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL3']. It must be equal or superior to the acr send from the RP in the Authentication Request.
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the acr parameter and must be one of ['https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL1', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL2', 'https://www.spid.gov.it/SpidL3']

Input to test: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'at_hash' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must match the base64url encoding of the left-most half of the hash of the octets of the ASCII representation of the access_token value the Access Token returned with the Token ID
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'at_hash' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must match the base64url encoding of the left-most half of the hash of the octets of the ASCII representation of the access_token value the Access Token returned with the Token ID
Output: Compliant if the ID Token's at_hash parameter value matches the Access Token returned with the Token ID, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does ID token payload contain a correct 'at_hash' parameter
Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'at_hash' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must match the base64url encoding of the left-most half of the hash of the octets of the ASCII representation of the access_token value the Access Token returned with the Token ID
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the at_hash parameter and its value must match the Access Token returned with the Token ID. Its value is the base64url encoding of the left-most half of the hash of the octets of the ASCII representation of the access_token value

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request without the aud parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request without the aud parameter in the JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests without the aud parameter
Description: The aud parameter identifies subjects of that request. An entity whose identifier is not in the audience of the request should refuse that request. In this test an authorization request is sent to the OP with an aud parameter that does not contains its identifier and the response of the OP is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the aud parameter and it must contain the OP's identifier (issuer parameter in OP's metadata)

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'aud' parameter in the Payload set to the RP's 'client_id'
Output: Compliant if the ID Token has the aud parameter set to the RP's client ID, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT ID Token contain the 'aud' parameter in the Payload set to RP's 'client_id'
Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'aud' parameter in the Payload set to the RP's 'client_id'
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the aud parameter and it must contain the RP's client_id

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the type of the 'exp' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must be a timestamp
Output: Compliant if the ID Token contains the exp claim and its value is a timestamp, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT ID Token contain a correct 'exp' parameter in the Payload
Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the type of the 'exp' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must be a timestamp
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the exp parameter

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'iat' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must be a timestamp
Output: Compliant if the ID Token contains the iat claim and its value is a timestamp, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT ID Token contain a correct 'iat' parameter in the Payload
Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'iat' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must be a timestamp
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the iat parameter
Reference OAuch: Are all required required claims present (HasRequiredClaims)

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'iss' parameter has to be an HTTPS URL identifying the OP
Output: Compliant if the ID Token contains the iss parameter as an HTTPS URL that identifies the OP, not Compliant otherwise

Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'iss' parameter has to be an HTTPS URL identifying the OP
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the iss parameter and it must be an HTTPS URL

Input to test: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'iss' parameter is checked equals to the URL of the OP
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'iss' parameter is checked equals to the URL of the OP
Output: Compliant if the ID Token contains the iss parameter equals to the URL of the OP, not Compliant otherwise

Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the value of the 'iss' parameter is checked equals to the URL of the OP
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the iss parameter and it must be equal to the URL of the OP

Input to test: Token response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'nonce' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must be set to the 'nonce' value set in the Authentication Request
Output: Compliant if the ID Token contains the nonce claim and its value is the same as the nonce in the Authentication Request made before, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the issued JWT ID Token contain the 'nonce' parameter in the Payload
Description: The ID Token present in the Token Response is taken, the payload is base64url decoded, analyzed and the presence of the 'nonce' parameter in the Payload is checked. In particular, its value must be set to the 'nonce' value set in the Authentication Request
Requirement: The JWT ID Token Payload requires the nonce parameter and it must be set to the nonce value sent in the Authentication Request
Reference OAuch: Is the nonce present in the ID token (NoncePresentInToken)
Reference OpenID Connect Conformance Pro: ID Token has nonce when requested for code flow

Input to test: Token Response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Token request with grant_type set to refresh_token and a valid refresh_token
Output: Compliant if the Token Response does not contain the ID Token, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP release ID Tokens with the use of refresh tokens
Description: In this test the offline access flow is accomplished and a refresh token is obtained. After this, a new token request is done with 'grant_type=refresh_token' and the refresh token inserted in the 'refresh_token' parameter. The response must not include the ID Token
Requirement: The Refresh Token MUST NOT allow the requesting RP to obtain an ID Token, neither the one previously issued during authentication nor a new ID Token

Input to test: This test verifies the presence of Pragma set to 'no-cache' in the token response.
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger This test verifies the presence of Pragma set to 'no-cache' in the token response.
Output: Compliant if the token response has Pragma set to 'no-cache', not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the token response have Pragma set to 'no-cache'
Description: This test verifies the presence of Pragma set to 'no-cache' in the token response.
Requirement: The error Token response must have Pragma set to 'no-cache'

Input to test: Tokens issued by an OP must have the structure of JWT Tokens. In particular, this structure is composed by three base64url encoded strings separated by dots, namely the header, payload and signature. The signature is made using the OP's private key, in such a way to be decrypted using its public key. In this test an offline_access flow is performed and the obtained Refresh token is analyzed. In order to test if the OP correctly signed the signature part of the JWT, the Refresh token is passed to a signature verifier correctly configured
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request with scope openid offline_access and prompt contains consent
Output: Compliant if the signature of the Refresh token is correctly verified using the OP's public key, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP correctly sign the Refresh Token
Description: Tokens issued by an OP must have the structure of JWT Tokens. In particular, this structure is composed by three base64url encoded strings separated by dots, namely the header, payload and signature. The signature is made using the OP's private key, in such a way to be decrypted using its public key. In this test an offline_access flow is performed and the obtained Refresh token is analyzed. In order to test if the OP correctly signed the signature part of the JWT, the Refresh token is passed to a signature verifier correctly configured
Requirement: The Refresh Token MUST be a signed JWT

Input to test: Token Response
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request with scope profile and prompt contains consent
Output: Compliant if the token response does not contain the refresh_token parameter, not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP issue refresh tokens even when it is not supposed to
Description: In this test an RP makes an authentication request with an arbitrary scope that differs from 'offline_access'. Once received the code, the RP tries to exchange it in the token endpoint and the response must not contain the refresh token.
Requirement: The Token response, if succesful, returns an ID Token, an Access Token and possibly a Refresh Token (if the authentication request has scope=offline_access and prompt=consent)

Input to test: Token Response to a request with refresh token
Input to Entity Uder Test: Token request with grant_type set to refresh_token and a refresh_token whose corresponding access_token was revoked
Output: Compliant if the OP sends a successful token response, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP revoke the Refresh Token when revoking an Access Token
Description: In order to test if the OP revokes a refresh token together with the access token revocation, a classic authentication flow is computed and, once obtained the access token and the refresh token, the access token is used to login. Finally, a logout is performed (thus revocating the access token), a token request using the refresh token is accomplished and the OP's response analyzed.
Requirement: The Access Token revocation MUST NOT imply revoking all the Refresh Tokens linked to it.
Reference OAuch: Are refresh tokens revoked after access token revocation (AccessRevokesRefresh)
Note: The OAuch outcome is in contrast with ours and with the one in the specification: for OAuch if the related refresh token is revoked, than this is compliant, in the CIE scenario it is not

Input to test: Token Response to a request with an already-used refresh token
Input to Entity Uder Test: Token request with offline_access grant type and an already-used refresh token in it
Output: Compliant if the Token Response is an HTTP 400 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP invalidate already-used refresh tokens
Description: A Token Request with the grant_type=refresh_token and the refresh token in it is sent. Even if the response will contain a new access token and a new refresh token, the next step is trying to refresh again the access token with the already-used refresh token and analyze the response
Requirement: For security reasons, an OP MUST return, along with a new Access Token, also a new Refresh Token, invalidating all previously issued tokens (refresh token rotation) to the RP and related to the end-user
Reference OAuch: Is the active refresh token revoked after a multi-exchange (InvalidatedRefreshToken)

Input to test: The Refresh Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the presence of the 'aud' parameter in the Payload is checked.
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The Refresh Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the presence of the 'aud' parameter in the Payload is checked.
Output: Compliant if the JWT Refresh Token Payload has the aud parameter, not Compliant otherwise

Description: The Refresh Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the presence of the 'aud' parameter in the Payload is checked.
Requirement: The Refresh Token MUST contain the aud parameter

Input to test: The Refresh Token present in the Token Response is analyzed and the value of the 'aud' parameter in the Payload set to the identifier of the resource server

Output: Compliant if the JWT Refresh Token Payload has the aud parameter set to the identifier of the intended resource server, not Compliant otherwise

Requirement: The Refresh Token MUST contain the aud parameter

Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise

Input to test: Authentication Response to a request without the client_id parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication request without the client_id parameter in the JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests without the client_id parameter
Description: The 'client_id' parameter in an authentication request's JWT identifies the RP sending the request. In order to test if the OP checks this parameter, an authorization request is sent without the client_id in the JWT and the answer is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the client_id parameter and its value must be an HTTPS URL identifying the RP
Note: Check error code in the test (is changed)

Input to test: Authentication Request's request parameter
Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request with a wrong client_id parameter in the JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP correctly reject an invalid client_id parameter in an intercepted Authentication Request
Description: This test aims to check if the OP checks the correctness of the client_id parameter. The client id value contained must contain an URL identifying the RP, so in this test the Authentication Request is intercepted, the request parameter is decrypted, the client_id in it modified with a random (and invalid) one, the JWT re-encrypted, the signature re-calculated and sent. The OP should check the parameter and, seen that it is an invalid one, refuse the authentication request.
Requirement: The JWT content of the request parameter in the Authentication Request must contain the 'client_id' parameter. It MUST contain an HTTPS URL that uniquely identifies the RP.
Note: Not clear what the the client_id in the request must match and if it has to match something

Input to test: The Token error response is analyzed and the the error parameter in it is checked. It must have a value among 'invalid_request', 'invalid_client', 'unsupported_grant_type', 'invalid_grant', 'server_error', or 'temporarily_unavailable'
Input to Entity Uder Test: Trigger The Token error response is analyzed and the the error parameter in it is checked. It must have a value among 'invalid_request', 'invalid_client', 'unsupported_grant_type', 'invalid_grant', 'server_error', or 'temporarily_unavailable'
Output: Compliant if the Token Response has the error parameter and it is set to a value among 'invalid_request', 'invalid_client', 'unsupported_grant_type', 'invalid_grant', 'server_error', or 'temporarily_unavailable'. Not Compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the Token error response contain a correct error parameter
Description: The Token error response is analyzed and the the error parameter in it is checked. It must have a value among 'invalid_request', 'invalid_client', 'unsupported_grant_type', 'invalid_grant', 'server_error', or 'temporarily_unavailable'
Requirement: If the Token Request (both ID Token and Refresh Token) is invalid or unauthorized, the OP constructs the error response. This response needs to have the error parameter with the error code ('invalid_request' or 'unauthorized_client')

Input to Entity Uder Test: Authentication Request with wrong code_challenge_method parameter in the JWT
Output: Compliant if the Authentication response is an HTTP 302 because of invalid_request, not compliant otherwise
Test Name: Does the OP refuse Authentication Requests with a value of the code_challenge_method parameter wrong or not present in its metadata
Description: The 'code_challenge_method' parameter in the JWT of an authentication request says to the OP how to verify the code_challenge when receiving the token request. If one request has a wrong code_challenge_method, than the OP will not be able to verify this parameter. In order to test the OP's behavior, an Authenticaton request is sent with a wrong code_challenge_method (a method not present in the OP's metadata) and the answer is analyzed
Requirement: The JWT payload must contain the code_challenge_method parameter and its value must be in the code_challenge_methods_supported parameter of the OP's metadata
